revised_title: Ionization in Gases by Secondary β-Rays
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the ionization in various gases caused by secondary β-rays emitted by substances exposed to primary β-rays of radium. They found that the ionization is proportional to the pressure in the gas, and discussed the factors contributing to the ionization, such as slow-moving ions ejected from gas molecules and secondary cathode rays from the walls of the chamber.
